content.description: A confidence builder and great warm up to the nearby "The Big Chob Prevails."  Start with your hands in the shoulder-level crack and with your feet comfortably placed on the lowest crack.  Bump your left hand up before you move your feet up to match your right hand.  Use the crack to move the hands up before traversing to the left with your feet along a prominent rail.  The top out is easy and now you're warmed up.
content.location: Shorter than a 5 minute walk South of the "The Big Chob Prevails" and behind some smaller boulders higher up the hill.

content.description: Place your pad beneath the tree on the "Daggett" side of the boulder. Start with a left hand on the lower edge of a slopey rail, and a right hand in a side-pull pocket on the leftmost side of the boulder. Proceed with a right hand to an upper rail and pull to a good crimp on the left side. Get feet up and use a dope undercling to traverse to good crimps at the top. PLEASE DO NOT TOP OUT as the dismount is sketch.
content.location: Behind the branches of a small pine tree.

content.description: 15 foot granite boulder somewhat hidden behind a pine tree.
